author: Dennis S
text:
A Navy boat sank off the Chennai coast during the early hours on Thursday after a fire broke out in the engine. However, all six personnel on board the 15.6 metre-long boat were rescued by the crew of another boat and a ship sailing alongside.

The incident happened at 2 a.m. on Thursday when the Fast Interceptor Craft (T 304) boat was on a routine deployment about 90 nautical miles north east off the Chennai coast. The personnel on board were rescued by another boat (T 303) and a Fast Attack Craft INS Cheriyam (T 72), sources said.

Rear Admiral Alok Bhatnagar, Flag Officer in-charge of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry Area, told The Hindu , “As the fire in the engine could not be contained, there was damage to the boat, resulting in its sinking. There were six sailors on board.”

According to an official release, the fire caused extensive damage to the Fibre-glass Reinforced Plastic hull of the craft. An inquiry has been ordered to investigate the incident, it added.
title: Navy boat sinks off Chennai coast
